net.sourceforge.waters.model.module

Interface SimpleNodeProxy

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<NamedProxy>, ComparableProxy<NamedProxy>, NamedProxy, NodeProxy, Proxy
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleNodeElement

    public interface SimpleNodeProxy
extends NodeProxy

    A node representing a state.

    The states of a finite-state machine are represented as simple nodes in a graph, connected to each other by edges representing the state transitions. A simple node thus can be viewed as a point in a graph (GraphProxy) with edges (EdgeProxy) linking to it.

    The information attached to a simple node is mostly used for rendering.

    Name.
    A string identifying the node.
    Initial.
    A boolean flag identifying whether the node represents an initial state or not. In a deterministic graph, there must be exactly one initial node.
    Geometry information.
    In addition, each node may have layout information to describe the node's position in the graph, and the placement of the label, i.e., the name string, relative to the node.
    Author:
    Robi Malik

    • Method Detail

      • isInitial

        boolean isInitial()
        Gets the initial status of this node.
        Returns:
        true if this is an initial node, false otherwise.

      • getPointGeometry

        PointGeometryProxy getPointGeometry()
        Gets the geometric position of this node.
        Returns:
        A PointGeometryProxy identifying the position of the center of the circle representing this node in a graph.

      • getInitialArrowGeometry

        PointGeometryProxy getInitialArrowGeometry()
        Gets the position of the initial state arrow of this node. Initial nodes can be rendered using a small arrow pointing against the node. This attribute defines the relative position of the start point of that arrow. It only make sense for initial nodes and should be null in all other cases.
        Returns:
        A PointGeometryProxy identifying the start point of the initial state arrow relative to the centre of the node.

      • getLabelGeometry

        LabelGeometryProxy getLabelGeometry()
        Gets the geometric position of the label of this node.
        Returns:
        A PointGeometryProxy identifying the position of the label's anchor point relative to the center of the circle representing the node.
